definition: hatred/animosity/enmity/foe/enemy/to feel animosity toward (the wealthy, foreigners etc)

home/family/(polite) my (sister, uncle etc)/classifier for families or businesses/refers to the philosophical schools of pre-Han China/noun suffix for a specialist in some activity, such as a musician or revolutionary, corresponding to English -ist, -er, -ary or -ian/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: Others in the river"s lake worldly life, always has the countless their wicked ways his enemy."
sentences.chinese: 他人在江湖混跡一生，總是結下了數不清的冤孽仇家。

sentences.english: You've got no debts, no enimies, four years of service.
sentences.chinese: 你沒有債務，沒有仇家，四年的兵役。

sentences.english: You fors laugh when you mount your bayonet.
sentences.chinese: 你的仇家在你上刺刀時大笑。

sentences.english: You can intimidate your foe with the bayonet mounted.
sentences.chinese: 你可以裝好刺刀後恫嚇你的仇家。

to start a feud/to become enemies
to kill secretly/to stab in the back
